full_text:
Code Generation and Debugging

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the Guidewire code generation
process

¢ Differentiate between incremental and bulk
code generation

¢ Use Studio debugger

Code Generation

Code generation (1 of 2) G

¢ Acode generator processes a Guidewire resource defined in XML format (such as
PCF file, entities, typelists, etc.) and produces a Gosu or Java class

¢ In Studio, code generators process these resources and produce Gosu and Java
classes

* The generated classes are explicit and can be debugged
EAlasperson.eti

FAasperson.etx

Hava (configura’

Code generation (2 of 2)

* Two types
* Incremental code generators process one or more changed resource files in isolation
¢ Bulk code generators process a set of resources as a whole, therefore they take longer

¢ Incremental code generation is not an option for all resource types

Incremental vs Bulk code generators G&G

« Invoked * Invoked
* On Save * From CodeGen menu
¢ During project make ¢ During project rebuild
* Supported Guidewire resources ¢ Supported Guidewire resources
« PCF files * All resources
« Entities [REEPEMN Analyze Refactor Build Run

A Generate Metadata Classes
Generate Page Configuration Classes
* Permissions w Generate Permission Classes

[ Generate Localization Classes

fe) Generate Xml Classes

* Typelists

be ad Generate Everything

Output of code generation G

: (J Include non-project files (Ctrl+Shift+N) Fo #

@ascontactAddressesLDVExpressions.gs (configuration\generated\pefc\expressions)
ress Ctrl+Up or Ctrl+Down to navigate through the history

@apmMedicalcareorg.java (configuration\generated\entity)

* The Expressions.gs and .java files can be debugged

UI Debug Options

Breakpoints G&G

¢ Abreakpoint indicates a place where you want to suspend the execution of Gosu
or Java code

¢ When breakpoint is hit
* Studio suspends code execution
« File with breakpoint opens in Studio
¢ Breakpoint line highlighted in blue
* Debug tool window opens
« You can debug
¢ Plain old Gosu and Java resources, such as Gosu Rules, Enhancements, Classes

* Generated Gosu and Java classes produced by the code generators

Main debugging tools

| Highlight widgets with PCF widths and heights G

¢ In InsuranceSuite, developers Exrcteyceme™ Seveteoe|” lentes

width and height values for UI
elements

¢ The Highlight widgets with
PCF widths and heights option
can be used to show developers

or height values that should be
changed to be dynamic

Batch Process Info

Show widget types as inline titles

The Show widget types
as inline titles option
makes it easy for
developers to see all the
elements on the screen

My Submissions

Demonstration

Review before the demo: PCF methods G&G

¢ APCF method is a plain old Gosu function that is local in a PCF file
* ...iS local (private) in the PCF file that defines it (not even referenced files can access it)

* ...cannot be debugged at the place of definition (you have to open the generated
<PCFFileName>Expressions.gs file after code generation, locate the method and put a
breakpoint there)

* ...is called from a widget property (e.g.: action, value, available, editable, etc.)

* PCF methods are defined on the Code tab of the main PCF Element — container
or location — and have direct access to the root object(s)

¢ The logic the function implements is typically tied to one or more widgets in that
PCF file, and it is not needed anywhere else. For example:

* determining the label (View or View/Edit) for a button
* determining if a TextInput widget is editable or not editable
* executing some initialization logic after navigating to a location

| Demo: Fix the bug G

We have just received the following bug report from the testers:
« Bug Description: /f / click on the ‘Delete Secondary Addresses’ button then the application
removes all the addresses - not only the secondary addresses but the primary one too. Please
fix it ASAP!

« Priority: High

Eiitrainingapp search|» contact |»
Person: Wiliam Andy

Addresses

1 Main Street, Santa Monica, CA 90402

1 Old Harbor Lane, Marina Det Rey, CA90292

United States| 5

Demonstration G

Fix the bug

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

oO” A code generator processes a Guidewire resource defined in XML format (such as

PCF file, entity, etc.) and produces a Gosu or Java class.

Question

Y generation.

MS SS

Answer G

¢

Y generation.
4

Possible answers:

* incremental code generator can process a single file, while bulk code generator
processes a set of files

¢ incremental code generation is not supported for every resource type

bulk code generation can be started from the CodeGen menu or during project

_- — What is a breakpoint?

Answer

_- — What is a breakpoint?

¢
oO” A breakpoint indicates a place where you want to suspend the execution of Gosu or

Java code

SS

Question

_- — What is a PCF method? How can you debug a PCF method?

¢
¢
4

MS SS

Answer

_~- — What is a PCF method? How can you debug a PCF method?
¢
oO” APCF method is a plain old Gosu function that is local in a PCF file and executes
some logic tied to that particular PCF file. You can open the
<PCFFileName>Expressions.gs file, find the function and click on the gutter area at

the desired line to set a breakpoint.

SS
